examples: A cup of tea sounds perfect.

examples: We're all imperfect human beings in an imperfect world.
We're all imperfect human beings in an imperfect world.

The message was that both easterners and Europeans were imperfect.
And, yes, we're imperfect, but you know what?
words.defineEn: having faults, flaws, or shortcomings

examples: She had no formal instruction in music.

words.defineEn: suitable for fancy, important, serious, or official occasions and situations
words.defineVi: thích hợp cho những dịp và tình huống ưa thích, quan trọng, nghiêm túc hoặc chính thức

words.defineEn: suitable for friendly, relaxed, casual, or unofficial occasions and situations

examples: When their schedules didn't align, the couple made a conscious effort to make time for each other.

He's conscious.
words.defineEn: having awareness of one's surroundings
words.defineVi: có nhận thức về môi trường xung quanh của một người

examples: Too many CEOs follow the ostrich plan, sticking their head in the sand in an unconscious effort to avoid bad news, and the responsibility that goes with it.
99.9% of what our brains process is unconscious.

She was almost unconscious and did not recognize him at first.
That's the power of our adaptive unconscious.

examples: The menu featured a creative dish of beef plate tacos.

examples: By no stretch of the imagination does the factory operate efficiently.

examples: The colorful bird flew high in the sky.

examples: I just shortened it

examples: Her intelligence and kindness make her the perfect girlfriend.

words.defineVi: một hành động quan tâm, tử tế, hoặc hữu ích

examples: She is a dedicated teacher who is passionate about nurturing and educating children.

examples: The drug produces a feeling of excitement.

examples: Guys automatically become less attractive when they break Priscian's head.

words.defineVi: không có suy nghĩ hay suy nghĩ

examples: It only takes one careless driver to cause an accident.

examples: The agreement followed months of negotiation.

examples: His help is useful as a chocolate teapot.

examples: Despite his efforts to conceal his true nature, his arrogance and selfishness eventually became evident to everyone.

And it's just, it would be the height of selfishness if I weren't to try to do that.

examples: A large volume of research indicates that multilingual people tend to link some aspects of life with one language and other aspects with another.

Just as there are many languages in the world, there are many ways to be multilingual.

Everybody loves a bilingual, multilingual person.

she puts her patients in touch with a great acupuncturist in London.

Small cracks appeared in the wall.
words.defineEn: to become visible and noticeable
words.defineVi: để trở nên có thể nhìn thấy và đáng chú ý

examples: Her husband disappeared into thin air for years.
Then you disappeared, went to ground.
The rough track continues, but it quickly disappears into undergrowth.
When the project manager disappeared for a week without any notice, we suspected she had taken French leave.
The internet is full of people who talk a big game, but when it comes to actually doing something, they disappear -
words.defineEn: to get out of sight or become impossible to see
words.defineVi: để có được ra khỏi tầm nhìn hoặc trở nên không thể nhìn thấy

examples: The slow healing process of the wound required regular care.
Regular exercise is essential for the healthfulness of your body and mind.
For a gluten-free option, substitute regular flour with almond flour in the cake recipe.
A regular newsletter keeps people in touch with local events.
Regular investment of small amounts of money is an excellent way of building a nest egg.
words.defineEn: following a pattern, especially one with fixed or uniform intervals
words.defineVi: theo một mẫu, đặc biệt là một mẫu có khoảng thời gian cố định hoặc thống nhất

examples: Irregular rainfall led to a decline in swamplands in many corners of the world.
But irregulars are a tiny fraction of all verbs.
The last common type of galaxy is an irregular galaxy.
Where do irregular verbs come from?
Irregular verbs on the other hand, have to be memorized.
words.defineEn: not conforming to established rules, patterns, or norms
words.defineVi: không tuân thủ các quy tắc, khuôn mẫu hoặc chuẩn mực đã được thiết lập

examples: I'm happy to get a little more bang for my bucks.
As they say, a happy heart is better than a full purse.
Since she moved to a smaller apartment, my mother is as happy as a flea in a doghouse!
With his new job and his new car, Andy is a happy camper.
After their break-up, she was happy to see the back of her ex-boyfriend.
words.defineEn: emotionally feeling good
words.defineVi: cảm xúc tốt

examples: I'm glad we can put this behind us.
We're glad to have you as part of our team.
I'm glad you read the riot act to Billy.
I felt glad to be back in harness.
I'm glad she's finally using her loaf.
words.defineEn: feeling happy or pleased
words.defineVi: cảm thấy hạnh phúc hoặc hài lòng

examples: It articulates.
Could you articulate the sides in that in Washington?
You would actually articulate that.
He also found some articulated vertebrae and some fragmented bones below those ribs.
So some people have described that as being really articulate.
words.defineEn: (of a person) able to express oneself clearly and effectively
words.defineVi: (của một người) có thể thể hiện bản thân một cách rõ ràng và hiệu quả

examples: Flamenco is a traditional Spanish dance that is known for its expressive movements.
My face is less expressive.
Your eyes are so expressive.
They're really descriptive, very expressive.
Emotions involve physiological arousal, expressive behaviors and conscious experience.
words.defineEn: demonstrating or showing a strong or vivid display of emotions, feelings, or ideas
words.defineVi: thể hiện hoặc thể hiện một màn trình diễn mạnh mẽ hoặc sống động về cảm xúc, cảm xúc hoặc ý tưởng

examples: "That boy isn't very bright."
These shrubs produce bright red berries.
The bird had bright feathers and a long beak.
Some bright spark left the tap running all night.
I arrived bright and early at Brian the falconer's house for day one of my course.
words.defineEn: capable of thinking and learning in a good and quick way
words.defineVi: có khả năng tư duy và học hỏi một cách tốt và nhanh chóng

examples: Two could play at that game, smart guy.
After all, an electrical brain is smarter than the sum of its parts.
Buying a house in this neighborhood is a smart move.
He gained a reputation as a smart number-cruncher who could turn data into policy.
She's not too smart, but at least her heart is in the right place.
words.defineEn: able to think and learn in a good and quick way
words.defineVi: có thể suy nghĩ và học hỏi một cách tốt và nhanh chóng

words.defineEn: (of a person) not caring about the needs and feelings of no one but one's own
words.defineVi: (của một người) không quan tâm đến nhu cầu và cảm xúc của ai ngoài chính mình

examples: I simply can't tolerate her selfish behavior any longer.
One day you will all pay the price for your selfish behaviour.
Elliott accused me of being selfish.
I'm already fed up with your lazy, selfish behavior, Jim, but if you can't be bothered to come with me to my own mother's funeral, that will be the straw that breaks the donkey's back!
The human condition is selfish, to some extent.
words.defineEn: always putting one's interests first and not caring about the needs or rights of others
words.defineVi: luôn đặt lợi ích của mình lên hàng đầu và không quan tâm đến nhu cầu hay quyền lợi của người khác

examples: Their arrogant attitude is what really made my hackles rise.
The CEO's promotion to a higher position brought out a more arrogant side of him, demonstrating how honors change manners.
The arrogant CEO refused to alter his unrealistic deadline despite mounting evidence of its impracticality, demonstrating that he was a fool, as a wise man changes his mind, a fool never.
They trade pragmatic advice, friendly jokes and not-so-friendly barbs about their arrogant peers.
It was to me, arrogant to see this gift and then let it die.
words.defineEn: having a proud, unpleasant attitude toward others and showing an exaggerated sense of self-importance
words.defineVi: có thái độ tự hào, khó chịu với người khác và thể hiện thái độ tự trọng quá mức

words.defineEn: having or displaying the belief that one is superior in intellect, importance, skills, etc.
words.defineVi: có hoặc thể hiện niềm tin rằng một người vượt trội về trí tuệ, tầm quan trọng, kỹ năng, v.v.
